flawed_nl_solution:
There are 300 x 2/3 = <<300*2/3=200>>200 females in the school.
So, 300 - 200 = <<300-200=1000>>1000 are males.
Out of the 1000 males, 1000 x 1/10 = <<1000*1/10=100>>100 are male foreign students.
Thus, there are 1000 - 100 = <<1000-100=900>>900 non-foreign male students.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 100, not 1000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
